intro: Arenaria bertolonii f. morisii, commonly known as the Morisii sandparsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically produces white or pale pink blossoms that bloom in the spring. It is adapted to rocky and sandy soils, often found in alpine or arctic environments. This subspecies is notable for its horticultural value and resilience in harsh climates.
